channel.title: Remote assistance
channel.description: Well, My gma is new to the computer, and uhm.. she needs alot of help. Well, we live in different states, and she doesnt know how to do [b]anything[/b]... I know things like crossloop and teamviewer but you have to enter a code, and my gma can't even do that. Is there anything that I can connect to her computer if its on, whenever I want...

item.title: Remote assistance
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Payback Is A Bitch, post:6, topic:246325”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=322797.msg2551390#msg2551390 date=1227570073]
I got a way easier way. Use MSN Live Messenger, you can use a special program in there that acts as a remote desktop between you and another person. Should be exactly what you’re looking for.
[/quote]But its the point that my gma don’t know how to do anything[/quote]

Then good luck helping her.

Read full topic

item.title: Remote assistance
item.dc:creator: @Payback_Is_A_Bitch Payback Is A Bitch
item.description:
@Payback_Is_A_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:2, topic:246325”][quote author=Payback Is A Bitch link=topic=322797.msg2550563#msg2550563 date=1227488972]
Well, My gma is new to the computer, and uhm… she needs alot of help. Well, we live in different states, and she doesnt know how to do anything… I know things like crossloop and teamviewer but you have to enter a code, and my gma can’t even do that. Is there anything that I can connect to her computer if its on, whenever I want…
[/quote]

VNC View or RDP but you will have to set it up for here.

I use hamachi and RDP (RDP comes with XP Pro or Vista Business Ultimate)[/quote]I got VNC, and I portforwarded and everything… But, not a clue how to set it up :s…

Read full topic

item.title: Remote assistance
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

There is an easy way to do it both on xp and vista.

http://www.windowsnetworking.com/articles_tutorials/wxprmass.html

As I recall, that tutorial should work for vista as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Remote assistance
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

VNC View or RDP but you will have to set it up for here.

I use hamachi and RDP (RDP comes with XP Pro or Vista Business Ultimate)

Read full topic
